page.title: 16History of Llanover village
page.content: This school was erected by the late Lord Treowen as a memorial to his son and heir Captain Elidyr Herbert killed on active service in Palastine in Nov 1917.The school forms part of the model village of Tre Elidyr Llanover the whole of which is a memorial to the solders of world war1.There are18 houses built from local stone and timber .20 were planned but 2 were unfinished when Lord Treowen died. The houses surround a village green which are now the playing fields.The war memorial is of undressed stones from the local quarry.On top of the stones is a gilded cross.Behind the cross is a recess in which are 3 brass plaques bearing an inscription and the names of the fallen. An arc of lime trees was planted one for each of the fallen an avenue of lime trees leads through the green to the memorial.
